data.title: Career Areas
data.text:
Are you ready to start picturing yourself at LLNL? We offer a variety of jobs in all areas across our campus. Whether you're a nuclear physicist or a skilled machinist, we have a home for you.

But first, what does it mean when you see "Organization: Physical and Life Sciences" in one of our job postings? We are comprised of different organizations that focus on a different aspect of our overall mission. As an employee, you'll be a part of one of these organizations (such as Computing, Global Security, or Weapons & Complex Integration). It's helpful to understand these organizations, since you might be drawn to the goals of one more than others. Together, these organizations contribute to our overall national security mission.

Learn more about us below.

Explore career areas

What does it mean when you see "Career Area: Craft & Skilled Labor" in one of our job postings? Each of the organizations above is comprised of people with different skill sets. As an electrician, for example, you might be part of Engineering, the Director's Office, or any of the other organizations. The same goes for many of the jobs you'll find on our job search page. When searching for a job with us, you can choose to narrow your search by career area, or a combination of career area and organization.

Explore our different career areas and find the right place for you.
